posts.post_content: When I first saw this, I thought it was a strictly better [Soul's Fire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul's Fire). Then I realized it only hits creatures. Play with [Purphoros, God of the Forge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Purphoros, God of the Forge) for extra flavor points.

Posted By: A3Kitsune (1/29/2014 2:13:47 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
4/5  
Solid Removal most of the time for red. What's not to like? I see this almost like **[Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade)** except red, and dependent on you controlling strong creatures rather than the target being the right color. Fire-breathing creatures probably will go well with this as well. **[Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade)** is still better for those large creatures I suppose though, but this is also common.  
  
edit: Just realized this also triggers **Heroic**!

posts.post_content: One-sided fight is better than the alternative. Still, this feels very much like a green card other than the name. Which is interesting considering only green would run this as red has much better ways to deal with creatures--ie. burn. I see this has a 4 star rating so I can only assume those people rated this based on Limited only since outside of that it's worse than pretty much any 2-mana burn red has.

Posted By: RamenAwesome (2/21/2014 12:17:59 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Essentially, this is a one-sided, instant-speed, Red [Prey Upon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prey Upon) for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol).   
  
In limited with things like [Baleful Eidolon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baleful Eidolon) or [Sedge Scorpion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sedge Scorpion), it's basically just a kill spell.   
  
Even without Deathtouch, you can use this on your First Strike creature when your creature didn't have enough power to kill a certain creature (since damage goes away at the end of turn). There have been many times when I combo'ed this with [Rise to the Challenge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rise to the Challenge).  
  
Also, this works with Heroic. Dealing 6 damage to a creature while also being able to give 3 +1/+1 counters to your [Centaur Battlemaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Centaur Battlemaster) for ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) is game-changing.  
  
As much as I'd like to not bring too much attention to this card (since I've noticed people don't draft these that often), this card should be early-picked.
posts.html:
Essentially, this is a one-sided, instant-speed, Red Prey Upon for .

In limited with things like Baleful Eidolon or Sedge Scorpion, it's basically just a kill spell.

Even without Deathtouch, you can use this on your First Strike creature when your creature didn't have enough power to kill a certain creature (since damage goes away at the end of turn). There have been many times when I combo'ed this with Rise to the Challenge.

Also, this works with Heroic. Dealing 6 damage to a creature while also being able to give 3 +1/+1 counters to your Centaur Battlemaster for is game-changing.

As much as I'd like to not bring too much attention to this card (since I've noticed people don't draft these that often), this card should be early-picked.

posts.post_content:
If you have a [Wasteland Viper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wasteland Viper) (or [Agent of the Fates](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Agent of the Fates), [Archetype of Finality](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Archetype of Finality), [Baleful Eidolon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baleful Eidolon), [Deadly Recluse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deadly Recluse), [Deathgaze Cockatrice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=370775), [Hythonia the Cruel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hythonia the Cruel), [Keepsake Gorgon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Keepsake Gorgon), [Korozda Gorgon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Korozda Gorgon), [Liliana's Reaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana's Reaver), [Master of Cruelties](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master of Cruelties), [Maze Abomination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maze Abomination), [Sedge Scorpion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sedge Scorpion), [Sluiceway Scorpion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sluiceway Scorpion), or [Thrill-Kill Assassin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thrill-Kill Assassin)) on the field, this becomes a red [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) that can kill any targetable creature.  
  
Fall of the Hammer compares favorably to [Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood) and [Pit Fight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pit Fight). If that Gruul devotion/monstrous deck becomes competitive, I'm sure this will see standard play with [Xenagos, God of Revels](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Xenagos, God of Revels)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
If you have a Wasteland Viper (or Agent of the Fates, Archetype of Finality, Baleful Eidolon, Deadly Recluse, Deathgaze Cockatrice, Hythonia the Cruel, Keepsake Gorgon, Korozda Gorgon, Liliana's Reaver, Master of Cruelties, Maze Abomination, Sedge Scorpion, Sluiceway Scorpion, or Thrill-Kill Assassin) on the field, this becomes a red Doom Blade that can kill any targetable creature.

Fall of the Hammer compares favorably to Blood and Pit Fight. If that Gruul devotion/monstrous deck becomes competitive, I'm sure this will see standard play with Xenagos, God of Revels... (see all)
